alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 12:56AM CST until February 06 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 AM CST, Monroe County Emergency Management reported numerous roads in central and southern Monroe County remain closed due to 5 to 10 inches of rain that occurred Thursday evening. While the heavy rain has ended, small creeks and streams are still either cresting or continuing to rise. This is resulting in the continued flooding of some roads. In addition, some roads may have experienced washouts, particularly on county dirt roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Frisco City, Peterman, Uriah, Excel, Megargel, Manistee, Goodway, Mexia Crossing, Mexboro, Mexia, Jeddo, Halls Crossroads, Ollie, West Monroeville, Palmers Crossroads, Homewood, Drewry, Monroeton and Renson.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
